Text: LNG Questions Cc A couple of questions Check the DOE Northeast Heating season report There seem to be a lot of LNG terminal and facilities in the Northeast How do they work What are the logistics of transportation etc Arnolds buddy has been looking into the logistics of trucking LNG to CA Is this possible Can investigate the probability Thanks JF

Fuel Switchingattached report contains an analysis of fuel switching capability It also details one of the current problems with EIA data The EIA data contains FERC form I data Once generation is sold its fuel consumption is no longer reported to the DOE Hence an analysis of the DOE cost and quality of generation fuels is incomplete becasue of the lack of NUG data WEFA gets around this by using FERC FORM I data After there were significant sales of generation due to the ongoing legislation and deregulation at the state level NGMpdf

RE ACROSS THE BOARD REDUCTION IN ENE HEADCOUNTno need to eliminate specialization but there is a huge amount of duplication for the record i am not weaseling my way into the chief fundamentalist rolei think the specialization could remain but teh information should be commonly housed and centrallly disseminated For example why dio we need stack modelsit would be better to concentrate our effort and knowledge on making on great one also in terms of headcount elimination of dupplication means reduced costsdo we really need to be hiring analysts a year where are we going to put them all lets keep the strongest and ditch the rest Original Message From Arnold John Sent Monday October PM To Fraser Jennifer Subject RE ACROSS THE BOARD REDUCTION IN ENE HEADCOUNT maybe some specialization is Physical RFP Requests for nOV mAR nIPSCO PIEDMONT AND WEST kY SYSTEMSplease SEND TO to correct individuals Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday October PM To undisclosedrecipients Subject Dear Supplier Dominion Energy Consulting is the Fuel Manager and Agent for ER Carpenter Co We are soliciting supply offers from your company on the attached load profiles for the term period November through March We understand each supplier cannot serve all locations so bid only on those where you are competitive Your offers should include Full Firm Requirements NYMEX basis to the City Gate The location and LDC is included with each plant

FW Enron Europe Organization Announcement VOLUNTARY LAYOFFSEnron has had a very good year to date and we at Enron Europe have played our part in this However if we are to maintain growth levels we need to focus very closely on our cost base and create more efficiencies in the current round of Enron Corp budget reviews We are analysing much more closely exactly which businesses we derive our earnings from and concentrating our resources on those areas We will be taking decisions to put some projects on the back burnerand reduce the scope of others This will inevitably mean that we need to reduce our headcount both in commercial and commercial support groups as we seek to identify the best mix of skills to keep us on our earnings growth track To this end we will be seeking to cut our headcount in Europe by between five and ten percent but we will aim as far as possible to achieve this through a program of voluntary severance Details of this program will be made available by Monday th October We hope to complete this exercise and communicate the outcome as quickly as possible in October so that everyone knows where they stand Please feel free to contact either of us but also talk to your supervisor about any specific concerns you may have and remember that you can also make use of the LifeWorks confidential counselling service that is available on We firmly believe that if we work hard together now to achieve these short term goals we will create a stronger more flexible team at Enron which will be better placed than ever to grow our business in Europe John Sherriff and Michael Brown

RE ENE is a Buythat possibility is slim to none Original Message From Arnold John Sent Thursday October PM To Fraser Jennifer Subject RE ENE is a Buy depends on the legal outcome thhere is still a possibility we get all of our money back although a roe of for years Still a better roe than broadband investments Original Message From Fraser Jennifer Sent Thursday October AM To Arnold John Subject ENE is a Buy dabhol will be written down before it is sold PDFpdf

RE ng zfghJA I concur Producer shutins are BS they have not felt any pain Economic recovery is a no show Im trying to understand next summer a little better still owe u my notes on FPL and AEP will do when i Get back on Thursday u still long GD great job this month Original Message From Arnold John Sent Mon PM To Fraser Jennifer Cc Subject RE ng zfgh bearish still but a matter of timing current rally a function of reshaping the curve with incremental stg still available to ecourage economic withdraws come december think recent increase in bullish fundamental situation is more a result of price in bid week than anything else Think that with this bidweek being as we stand now above resid and above the coal stack fundamentals worsen considerably to the point where price must go down Still very bearish first half Original Message From Fraser Jennifer Sent Mon PM To Arnold John Cc Subject ng zfgh any thoughts

simmons expects an upward aga revisionOriginal Message From Scott Eric Sent Friday October AM To Fraser Jennifer Subject FW Morning Notes Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESmfraziersimmonscointlEcom NRONcom Sent Friday October AM To David utnaminvcom SRMcom Scott Eric Bradley Michael W Subject Morning Notes Yesterdays move in energy probably the most interesting thing to talk about today While the move from below in OSX makes sense from valuation timing still very suspect In order of importance we would attribute the move to Broader Mkt Commodities Firmness Geopolitical situation Shrort Covering FEAR OF MISSING MOVE OFF BOTTOM Resistance levels XNG right here OSX ish Intl Rig Count to We see a stabilization at this level in the world wide rig count SII had conversation w mgmt Sept business actually better than Aug Unlike BJS They do expect downtick and have seen lower utilization at bit plantAdditionally they have repurchased stock We do expect AGA to revise upward the b injection reported yesterday

not much of rally on afghan bombingbrent puked it out pretty hard on fridayprobably as good as it gets to sell this puppy for your benefit make sure you get someone to go back and look closely at relative storage levels and prices levels for all btus in relationahips as you recall get bizarre on the lower end of the spectrumits a good couple of graphs to keep around all stocks as a full chart btus equi chart vs vs diffs in If i could access this info id send itbut enron systems being what they are it takes hours to connnect to houston drive

RE NSPI ISDA Updatelets review the facts and get an answer to the customer In July of we sent a draft ISDA to NSPI MM Line because their excellent credit In October NSPI sent comments back No one from Enron ever responded In July I sold NSPI q and q weather pust On Februaryth i sent an email to B reves T Jones and ask ing that an updated ISDA be sent to the cusatomer as they had undergone a name chang e and we wanted the ISDA to cover weather deals a copy is attached The customer is still without a document and their letter of October remains unanswered Can we please get this issue resolved From Jennifer Fraser To Tana CT Brant CT Kevin NRON cc Don Keith donald keith Subject ISDA for Nova Scotia Power Tana and Brant We sent an ISDA to NSPI Nova Scotia Power Inc on July The CP would like to get an updated copy in order to have an agreement in place W e have done some financial deals weather puts I believe they are also an active counterparty with us in coal physical Can you please send an updated agreement to Don Keith Treasurer Nova Scotia Power Inc Barrington St th Floor Scotia Square Halifax NS Canada BJ A Phone fax The website for the CP is Their finacials can be found at Please note that NSPI Emera is a publicly traed utility they are not govt owned Original Message From Lassander Richard Sent Mon To Fraser Jennifer Cc Subject NSPI ISDA Jen An update with regards to the Nova Scotia Power ISDA After several days of trying to hunt down Brant Reves he referred me to Rudwell Johnson in Credit He in turn sent me back to Tana Jones because there is an ISDA issued and y ou dont have to renew it if it is already in place I go back to Tana Jones t o see if the ISDA sent to Nova Scotia in July included Weather Derivatives Tana Jones referred me back to Sara Shackleton I left a voice mail with Sara this afternoon Through this process I found out that the IS DA sent to NSPI in July was never executed and we need to execute it befo re we can do any deals with them I was under the impression that we already have been doing deals with them Richard Lassander Enron Global Markets Phone Fax
Orlando Utilities CommisionCan you please call me about the ISDA for this company Thanks Jen

Weather Person for London EGM Cc to set a further round of inteviews for Tony Hamilton Can everyone let Gloria Solis know their availability over the next weeks Below are the results from our initial interviews and the candidates resume Thanks Jen Forwarded by Mike A RobertsHOUECT on AM Tony Hamilton on AM Please respond to Tony Hamilton To cc Subject MeteorologistForecaster Dear Mike I would like to apply for the above position as advertised in EARTHWORKS and enclose my full CV In Word format in support I am currently a research Fellow with UCL conducting research and building forecasting models for the statistical prediction of North Atlantic Sea Surface Temperatures and other climatic parameters at long leads months ahead of forecast period I have recently applied this model to the North Sea in order to aid longlead forecasts of Fish Stocks see SAPsymposium December Bergen Norway and have recently been applying similar models to the North Atlantic Oscillation an atmospheric phenomena which is strongly correlated with winter climate over UKNorway and NW Europe particularly temperatures rainfall and windspeeds see enclosed poster which was presented recently at an international conference on the NAO in Vigo Spain As you will see from my CV I have years experience consulting in several areas of geoscience to the oil gas and minerals industries and have good programming skills both on Unix machines and on PCs I am particularly keen to apply my skills in the commercial sector and initiate a permanent career path I look forward to the opportunity of hopefully discussing my skills further with you in the near future Yours sincerely Tony Hamilton Dr Tony Hamilton Research Fellow Benfield Greig Hazard Research Centre Department of Space and Climate Physics University College London HOLMBURY ST MARY Dorking Surrey RH NT Email Telephone Fax Website THCVdoc NAOPosterVgif Forwarded by Jennifer FraserHOUECT on From Jennifer Fraser To Jeffrey A CT Chris CT Mike A CT Vince J CT cc Stewart CT Niamh CT Subject Weather Person for London EGM Folks We interviewed three candidates One of the three Tony Hamilton seems to be a very good fit within the Enron culture and values Recommended Next Steps Vince Mike and Jeff interview Tony via video conference or avistar Tony Hamilton Key Strengths Quick thinker Good teams skills Driven will be able to get the project off the ground quickly Has a commercial attitude Sees the big picture Tony Hamilton is available for follow up interviews the first week of January Thanks Jen

Fundamentals Update London Tripand Jeff I have been working with Chris Mahoney to secure some real estate on the Global Markets Floor in London We will have seats behind the crude team Alex McLeish will manage London and Singapore crude and products fundamentals Brad Hitch will have responsibility for organizing the London coal petchems and lpg fundamentals teams We will be hiring or summer students cheaper and more flexibility than full time Alex McLeish and Andrew Hill have identified several candidates from some British schools Several schools in the UK have an energy petroleum specialist program Andrew will be interviewing some candidates this week I have asked the following people to manage the following commoties and teams Crude and Products Richard Lassander US Alex McLeish UK and Rest of World LNG Petchems LPG Lowell Bezanis Ags and Freight Jeff Andrews Coal Jen Fraser Our first panEGM commodity report will be published June th It will provide a short term fundamental outlook on all of our commodities Regards Jen

RE Enron Global Markets Cc I interviewed Adrian back in the fall I made him an offer to join my group but he elected to go to EES He is a hardworking bright individual who comes wellrecommended I told him at the time he would be welcome on his next rotation I am still waiting to hear on this Jen Original Message From McConnell Mike Sent Thursday May AM To Fraser Jennifer Gonzales Eric Cc Shankman Jeffrey A Subject RE Enron Global Markets FYI and followup m Forwarded by Mike McConnellHOUECT on AM Adrian ES AM To cc Subject RE Enron Global Markets Mike It was nice talking to you at the EGM info session on Monday the th at the Hyatt As we discussed I am interested in opportunities within your group specifically the LNG arena I interviewed and discussed this issue with Greg Curran and Doug J Arnell on Tuesday the th I strongly believe in the mutual benefits derived both from my learning and ability to contribute to your efforts I am currently in my second rotation working for Dan Leff and Dick Leibert in EES I have been at Enron since In my former role I served as the controller for GPG Operations Support CO There I managed cost centers which perform OM Procurement Document Mgmt and Regulatory Services for GPG and other assets across the globe My role was the sole source for general administration budgeting planning and financial reporting This included management of M on a gross basis and overseeing the daytoday operation of the Mustang timesheet system I also represented my organization as a Subject Matter Expert SME for the July implementation of SAP within GPG In my first rotation in Enron Energy Services I performed analysis forecasting and pricing of power and gas risk management instruments Currently I am working on projects ranging from Customer Satisfaction system development and implementation budgetingspace management California Crisis Taskforce to new business ventures and cost savings initiatives Although an American citizen by birth I have also spent years living in the Caribbean I am a team player and a very motivated high energy individual My experience the responsibilities bestowed along my willingness to give will provide a valuable asset to a group I would like to generate a dialogue with you regarding the issue If there are any questions or requests of me please feel free to let me know Thank You Adrian Woolcock File ResumeIIdoc File Final AccomplishmentsAdrian Woolcockdoc Forwarded by Adrian WoolcockHOUEES on PM Fernando CT PM To Adrian ES Subject Letter to Eric Hope I explained it correctly He is moving to Houston in weeks so he must be very busy You should call him when he gets there I would say Fernando Herrera PM To Eric CT Subject Hi there LNG group candidate Hi Eric I started last Monday and this is VERY cool It is also going to be quite a challenge as the deals are much more complex than what I had the chance to see in Europe Seems that I am going to learn a lot so far expectations are met I am also writing you because I RE Enron Global Markets Cc I interviewed Adrian back in the fall I made him an offer to join my group but he elected to go to EES He is a hardworking bright individual who comes wellrecommended I told him at the time he would be welcome on his next rotation I am still waiting to hear on this Jen Original Message From McConnell Mike Sent Thursday May AM To Fraser Jennifer Gonzales Eric Cc Shankman Jeffrey A Subject RE Enron Global Markets FYI and followup m Forwarded by Mike McConnellHOUECT on AM Adrian ES AM To cc Subject RE Enron Global Markets Mike It was nice talking to you at the EGM info session on Monday the th at the Hyatt As we discussed I am interested in opportunities within your group specifically the LNG arena I interviewed and discussed this issue with Greg Curran and Doug J Arnell on Tuesday the th I strongly believe in the mutual benefits derived both from my learning and ability to contribute to your efforts I am currently in my second rotation working for Dan Leff and Dick Leibert in EES I have been at Enron since In my former role I served as the controller for GPG Operations Support CO There I managed cost centers which perform OM Procurement Document Mgmt and Regulatory Services for GPG and other assets across the globe My role was the sole source for general administration budgeting planning and financial reporting This included management of M on a gross basis and overseeing the daytoday operation of the Mustang timesheet system I also represented my organization as a Subject Matter Expert SME for the July implementation of SAP within GPG In my first rotation in Enron Energy Services I performed analysis forecasting and pricing of power and gas risk management instruments Currently I am working on projects ranging from Customer Satisfaction system development and implementation budgetingspace management California Crisis Taskforce to new business ventures and cost savings initiatives Although an American citizen by birth I have also spent years living in the Caribbean I am a team player and a very motivated high energy individual My experience the responsibilities bestowed along my willingness to give will provide a valuable asset to a group I would like to generate a dialogue with you regarding the issue If there are any questions or requests of me please feel free to let me know Thank You Adrian Woolcock File ResumeIIdoc File Final Fundamentals Update London Tripand Jeff I have been working with Chris Mahoney to secure some real estate on the Global Markets Floor in London We will have seats behind the crude team Alex McLeish will manage London and Singapore crude and products fundamentals Brad Hitch will have responsibility for organizing the London coal petchems and lpg fundamentals teams We will be hiring or summer students cheaper and more flexibility than full time Alex McLeish and Andrew Hill have identified several candidates from some British schools Several schools in the UK have an energy petroleum specialist program Andrew will be interviewing some candidates this week I have asked the following people to manage the following commoties and teams Crude and Products Richard Lassander US Alex McLeish UK and Rest of World LNG Petchems LPG Lowell Bezanis Ags and Freight Jeff Andrews Coal Jen Fraser Our first panEGM commodity report will be published June th It will provide a short term fundamental outlook on all of our commodities Regards Jen

RE NSPI ISDA Updatelets review the facts and get an answer to the customer In July of we sent a draft ISDA to NSPI MM Line because their excellent credit In October NSPI sent comments back No one from Enron ever responded In July I sold NSPI q and q weather pust On Februaryth i sent an email to B reves T Jones and ask ing that an updated ISDA be sent to the cusatomer as they had undergone a name chang e and we wanted the ISDA to cover weather deals a copy is attached The customer is still without a document and their letter of October remains unanswered Can we please get this issue resolved From Jennifer Fraser To Tana CT Brant CT Kevin NRON cc Don Keith donald keith Subject ISDA for Nova Scotia Power Tana and Brant We sent an ISDA to NSPI Nova Scotia Power Inc on July The CP would like to get an updated copy in order to have an agreement in place W e have done some financial deals weather puts I believe they are also an active counterparty with us in coal physical Can you please send an updated agreement to Don Keith Treasurer Nova Scotia Power Inc Barrington St th Floor Scotia Square Halifax NS Canada BJ A Phone fax The website for the CP is Their finacials can be found at Please note that NSPI Emera is a publicly traed utility they are not govt owned Original Message From Lassander Richard Sent Mon To Fraser Jennifer Cc Subject NSPI ISDA Jen An update with regards to the Nova Scotia Power ISDA After several days of trying to hunt down Brant Reves he referred me to Rudwell Johnson in Credit He in turn sent me back to Tana Jones because there is an ISDA issued and y ou dont have to renew it if it is already in place I go back to Tana Jones t o see if the ISDA sent to Nova Scotia in July included Weather Derivatives Tana Jones referred me back to Sara Shackleton I left a voice mail with Sara this afternoon Through this process I found out that the IS DA sent to NSPI in July was never executed and we need to execute it befo re we can do any deals with them I was under the impression that we already have been doing deals with them Richard Lassander Enron Global Markets Phone Fax

FW Plan A Request for Guidancetuesday am your place dude Original Message From Shankman Jeffrey A Sent Tuesday October AM To Fraser Jennifer Subject RE Plan A Request for Guidance Im back in the office on thursday and will go over then should we include Jeff A in this discussion Jeff Original Message From Fraser Jennifer Sent Monday October AM To Shankman Jeffrey A Subject Plan A Request for Guidance JS I have been working on the EGM Plan With this in mind could you please give me some guidance on the following topics Headcount Per my previous email Fundy Update I do not expect to increase headcount in H with the exception of the outstanding offer Spending on publications and other data sources Can you please tell me which businesses I should focus the most on Resources Again which areas should efforts be focused on London We will have people there in January director manager analysts If you are still considering bringing the crude team to London please let me know before any moveviasaetc expenses are incurred Thank you for your assistance JF

RE Cost Reductions and Better Information Across EWSNext Week I have a speech to give on Monday At Energy Buyers Confernce and they are picking the cost of accomodations and then I am back Will Schedule time on Tuesday with JB Original Message From Shankman Jeffrey A Sent Tuesday October AM To Fraser Jennifer Subject RE Cost Reductions and Better Information Across EWS when are you back in town lets talk about this Original Message From Fraser Jennifer Sent Tuesday October AM To Shankman Jeffrey A Mcconnell Mike Subject Cost Reductions and Better Information Across EWS JS MM Here is a quick summary of some my thoughts with regard to fundamentals as we begin finalization objectives and goals for I would like to discuss these issues with both you next week EWS Fundamentals The Time Has Come Phyically We are Together but Informationally We are Not ECS will be great for increasing phyisical proximity but what are we doing to increase the flow of information across desks commodities and people The MSG Board is a first step in the right direction But we need to finish the last mile Information is still not disseminated effectively Better Information and Rationalization of Resources It time to consider having one EWS fundamentals site It is both silly and a waste of resources to have multiple models for various commodities Information and efforts need to be shared across the company Having multiples sites also limits information flow to trading Traders should not have to search across multiple sites to receive information Why are different analysts doing the same job in three different groups Example Power Gas Crudeall do their own API analysis why have keep the best one and make it stronger Publications and IT are Expensive This year we have eliminated duplication within EGM with regard to publications It is now time to move cost consolidation across EWS Some publications cost in excess of K per year All duplication needs to be eliminated It is very expensive to keep IT teams developing different fundy sites In EGM alone this year we have spent MM on IT We need to stop the island mentality Leveraging off one platform could easily save millions I look forward to discussing these issues and receiving your feedback Thanks Jen

Cost Reductions and Better Information Across EWSJS MM Here is a quick summary of some my thoughts with regard to fundamentals as we begin finalization objectives and goals for I would like to discuss these issues with both you next week EWS Fundamentals The Time Has Come Phyically We are Together but Informationally We are Not ECS will be great for increasing phyisical proximity but what are we doing to increase the flow of information across desks commodities and people The MSG Board is a first step in the right direction But we need to finish the last mile Information is still not disseminated effectively Better Information and Rationalization of Resources It time to consider having one EWS fundamentals site It is both silly and a waste of resources to have multiple models for various commodities Information and efforts need to be shared across the company Having multiples sites also limits information flow to trading Traders should not have to search across multiple sites to receive information Why are different analysts doing the same job in three different groups Example Power Gas Crudeall do their own API analysis why have keep the best one and make it stronger Publications and IT are Expensive This year we have eliminated duplication within EGM with regard to publications It is now time to move cost consolidation across EWS Some publications cost in excess of K per year All duplication needs to be eliminated It is very expensive to keep IT teams developing different fundy sites In EGM alone this year we have spent MM on IT We need to stop the island mentality Leveraging off one platform could easily save millions I look forward to discussing these issues and receiving your feedback Thanks Jen

FW JeffOriginal Message From Solis Gloria Sent Wednesday August AM To Fraser Jennifer Subject FW Jeff Original Message From Delainey David Sent Wednesday August AM To All NRON Subject Jeff Dear friends The departure of Jeff like losing a member of your family is never a pleasant experience He has created immense wealth for the Enron shareholder over his eleven or so years at Enron We will all miss him However this is in our rear view mirror and we need to move forward to reach our goals I want to share a number of key points that should be well communicated and understood a Ken is reassuming the CEO role one that he has held for nearly fifteen years except for the last six months He understands this company He built Enron He is prepared to lead this company into the future for as long as it takes to reach our goals b The investment community knows Ken and likes his approach This is probably an upside given Jeffs struggles with this group c The key leaders in the organization across all of Enron including Greg Whalley John Lavorato Mark Frevert Jim Fallon Stan Horton amongst many others are clearly committed to Enron and its goals We are all firmly aligned behind Ken d There is no change to Enrons strategies and business principles going forward e The committment to the retail business is unwavering Support for EES within Enron is at its highest in years f There is a very deep talent base in Enron and all key origination trading and finance people are under contract and g My committment to our employees Enron and the retail energy business continues without question There will be a lot of distractions for the next few days it is very important that we move on and stay focused The retail and wholesale energy business must reach its short and long term goals I am confident we will be successful I am hoping to set up a number of floor meetings today to further discuss and answer any questions Regards Dave

Oil Fundamentals Choke Points Cc Eric Clay Here is a list of items we feel are the major determinants of oil price moves Please add your two cents Following your input I think we need to classify each as to whether they affect the pricedaily weekly or over the longterm JF Basic Economic Indicators GDP IP EU AP NA Transportation indices EGM fundy publishes a weekly truckingrailfreight economic series we are also trying to determine a diesel index based on freight capacity Refinery Indicators Cracks EGM post a daily analysis of cracks region by region and by crude type from to Marketing Margins secondary indicator Refinery Maintenance We suscribe to ISIsLORand publish a summary of the programs their effects on crudeie how much is disaplced Refinery Outage EGM fundy produces a daily global analysis Crude Oil OPEC GeoPolitical Events in the Middle East Africa NonOPEC Production Iraq US Crude Runs US imports PADD II Storage Levels Freight Rates Brent Loading Programs Crude Differentials WTI vs Brent vs WAFR ME crudes HiLo sulfur spreads impacts refinery output Regulations Auto Oil II EC Spec changes to HU and HO EPA Phase on HU and HO re sulfur specs PUC utility rules mandate all utilities with IT NG must back up with disl or resid and prove they have sufficient supply ahead of the winter season in US NE Heating Oil Intergeography arbs Storage levels especially PADD I New cogens Demand for low sulfur HO BTU equilibrium with natural gas can add or subtract Kbd of demand EGm publishes a btu report Weather EGM has a HDD demand model for US and are developing one for UKEC PL and Jones Act issues for Transportation Gasoline Intergeography arbs Conventional vs RFG HO vs HU Boutique HU kinds of FRG PL and Jones Act issues for Transportation Butane and MTBE costs Need to track NGL FRAC spread NG feestock costs Residual Fuel BTU equilibrium with natural gas can add or subtract Kbd of demand EGM publishes a btu report and has a switching model Utility storage and buying patterns Weather we have the HDD analysis Petroleum Statistics APIDOE EIA IEA

relationships figure out which large industrials are multifuel users and include them consider weather linked products HDD dependent hating oil calls coordinate with PER SEksere trigger options where Thursday July PM To Fraser Jennifer Cc Arnold John Subject RE coal and gas calculations As for Fuel Oil it doesnt seem to be working to hold the switching demand like we thought it would Prices are coming off but with Natty not moving much in the past few days it has made little effect On Mon seeing FPL selling almost bbls of NYh in Aug and Sep Mirant has been out the whole week buying and the utilities are also long Cal Cal but have yet to dump it Seeing utilities switch in the NYC region even though prices are slowly coming off Woudl expect if you get heat to see some utilities use their storage and burn some fuel but unless Natty goes back up to ish I think we may be off the mrkt for a little bit here Watchign for signs that may come back on after summer Additional issue being that demand as a whole is very weak so even wo Natty at such low levels we would be just a weak As of tonight NYH Jul bbl wo taxes and transport right off the barge Original Message From Fraser Jennifer Sent Thursday July PM To Arnold John Cc Mulholland Sarah Subject coal and gas calculations coal EAST t freight btulb therefore MMBTU heat rate therfore MWH nagural gas NYMEX most efficient new gen heat rate therefore mwh all back of the envelopebut when we get heat will gens increase coal push limitsor will gas become more of the baseload
